results.title: A City's child
results.creator_credit: Brian Kavanagh, Experimental Film and Television Fund of the Australian Council for the Arts and Kavanagh Productions
results.brief_description: An award-winning dramatic treatment of individual loneliness in a large city. Monica Maughan plays a spinster approaching middle age who lives with a dominating mother. After the death of her mother, unable to make human contact, she slips into a fantasy world in which a small doll becomes her “daughter”. The film was shot on 16mm for about $30,000.

results.title: A Circus story
results.creator_credit: Marshall Riggan, Major Carpenter, Barr Films and Marshall Majors Productions
results.brief_description: An account of the arrival, setting up and the performance of a circus in the small town of Berrybille, Arkansas, USA. Discusses the status, role and function of the circus today and suggests reasons for the romantic appeal of the circus. Suitable for secondary school level.

results.title: A Children's welcome
results.creator_credit: State Film Centre of Victoria and Victoria. Audio-Visual Education Centre
results.brief_description: This film was made in honour of the Queen Mother’s visit to Melbourne on March 3rd, 1958. A performance for the Queen Mother, by the school children of Victoria, was staged at the Melbourne Cricket Ground with items arranged by the Physical Education Department and accompanied by the RAAF Band. Family and friends were gathered in the stands of the MCG to watch and cheer on the children. At the end of the performance, the Queen Mother toured in an open car around the MCG.

results.title: A Chemical feast
results.creator_credit: Jack Sameth, Penny Bernstein and Benchmark Films
results.brief_description: Presents a humorous look at the chemical composition of a lemon meringue pie and the unit value of four convenience foods. Suitable for upper secondary level.

results.title: A Changing view of the change of life
results.creator_credit: Hy Kalus, Walter Lowendahl and Dynamic Productions
results.brief_description: Many questions relating to menopause are answered in this candid and informative film for women of all ages, and their families. Modern medical research has made startling discoveries about this period in a woman’s life and these have altered the traditional concepts about menopause. The film presents new attitudes and shows how doctors are dealing with the physical and emotional problems.

results.title: A Chance Affair
results.brief_description: Chance makes a declaration to his best mate Jeff only to realise that what he thought was there can disappear just like smoke. Meanwhile, club diva Aviante sends a message to all the little wannabes out there who try and sing Whitney’s signature songs.

constellations_other.name: Broadcasting marginal voices
constellations_other.description: The creation of Indigenous broadcasting in Central Australia from the late 1970s meant an array of diverse Black stories could be shared. Today, important stories told by those who physically and metaphorically live on the margins can be broadcast widely.

results.description: Chance makes a declaration to his best mate Jeff only to realise that what he thought was there can disappear just like smoke. Meanwhile, club diva Aviante sends a message to all the little wannabes out there who try and sing Whitney’s signature songs.

results.title: A Certified tractor
results.creator_credit: Robert Hesselschwerdt and Victoria. Dept. of Agriculture
results.brief_description: Shows the various methods of testing tractors by the Australian Tractor Testing Committee. Accurate measurement of belt and engine power, noise level at the driver’s ear and fuel consumption; pulling power; location of the centre of gravity; dismantling of engine and checking after 60 hours use; critical assessment of the general features.

results.title: A Career in commercial television
results.creator_credit: Tony Wellington and Artransa Park Studios
results.brief_description: Looks at the administrative, engineering and production aspects of commercial television, concentrating in particular on production. Stresses the limited opportunities available in this field and how most people in production commence work at the bottom rung of the production ladder. Narrated by Roger Climpson. Suitable for secondary school level.

results.title: A Bridge of friendship
results.brief_description: The 6th Boy Scout Jamboree held at Lansdowne, Sydney, 1960-1961, from the initial planning to the closing ceremony. Scouts from all over the world came for fifteen days, rigging tents, cooking, exchanging badges, singing around the campfire. Shows the march through Sydney and the visits of the Governor-General and other notable people.

results.title: A Boys' winter games lesson
results.creator_credit: Andrew Miller Jones and Gaumont-British Instructional
results.brief_description: This film shows a typical organised field games lesson for a class of boys aged 11 from an elementary school in a congested area of a big city. The lesson includes Association football and Rugby Touch, together with group practices leading up to these games. Based on British Board of Education Syllabus of Physical Training for Schools, 1933.
